answers.answer: Have you been evaluated by neuro doc for your headaches???

Hello,Is the lack of touch sensation confined to just one arm? If not I would begin by getting tested for diabetes. Chronic (long term) unmanaged diabetes can lead to a condition known as peripheral neuropathy (loss of feeling). If just present on one particular limb I would be thinking along the lines of a nerve intrapment possiblely from a injury but not always.Make sure you are eating a healthy well balanced diet containing sodium, potassium and calcium as they are involved in nerve inpulses. They are some conditions which attack the nervous system but they are much further on in the diagnosis. Any further question feel free to ask.RegardsDr Foot

question: Well I do have a few questions,i'm a 19 Year old adult, and I Find myself stuck in the usually daily issues. However In september of 2007 I fainted and because of my random fainting and unusual headackes, My hand have absoultly no feeling in them. I can't feel anything, weather it be pressure or heat or cold makes no diffrence. i faint Now on a regular bases, and the daily headeackes and the blackout spils are common... I Find my self throwing up everything i eat, and well i gett the spins everytime i stand sit or just watching tv.. I can handle most of the issues, but the only thing is, is the sence of touch... I miss being able to feel things, rather then find radom bruises of burns on my hands because i can't feel them... What could that be?
title: Is This Absoultly nessasary?
